resources.string: Complete the steps above before training the model
Select the \"Predict\" tab to predict your sounds

1. To train new data, tap on "Train"
 User is required to complete all the steps before training data. User has to provide 5 sounds, either by choosing YOUR CHOICE or PRE-DEFINED option.
 
YOUR CHOICE: the app provides 5 "Record" and 5 "Playback" boxes. A "Record" box records for 1 second using microphone, while a "Playback" box lets user hear back what has been recorded.
 
PRE-DEFINED: user chooses from a list from 9 provided sounds.
 

 2. To predict your sounds, tap on "Evaluate"
 User is required to train data first before evaluating their sounds.
 By tapping on the microphone icon, the app records and returns query result after every 3-second sound.
 (Note: this does not mean the app continuously returns result every 3 seconds. If a sound is 3-second long then the app will return the result after 3 seconds. If a sound is only 2-second long, the app has to listen for another second before returning the result)

"SoundWatch is an Android-based app designed for commercially available smartwatches to provide glanceable, always-available, and private sound feedback in multiple contexts. 
It began on ..., and is led by a hard of hearing University of Washington doctoral student who wanted to build for his community. Thus, SoundWatch has involved the DHH communities at many stages of its development, along with faculty advisors, student developers, programmers, and UI/UX designers. 
SoundWatch informs users about three key sound properties: sound identity, loudness, and time of occurrence through customizable sound alerts using visual and vibrational feedback. We use a deep learning-based sound classification engine (running on either the watch or on the paired phone or cloud) to continually sense and process sound events in real-time. SoundWatch supports four different architectural configurations: watch-only, watch+phone, watch+phone+cloud, and watch+cloud. 

Thank you for using SoundWatch! 
This is a beta release, so always feel free to connect with us to provide feedback so we can improve or to just say Hi!

How does the option "Your Choice" work? \n\nYou are prompted to enter a name for your sound and record the sound 5 times. Each recording is 1-second long, which means there are 5 1-second samples. You can play the recording back to see if it is the sound that you want. You can also record again for the same slot when you tap on the "Recorded" button.
If I already submitted my location, can I resubmit it? \n\nYou can re-enter the location as many times as you would like. Once you press the "Train Model" button, the final location is saved.
Why does Predict not return any result for my sound? \n\nThere are a couple of reasons. You might not have trained the sounds yet or the app simply does not recognize your untrained sound.

Why does Predict return incorrect results for a sound when I have trained it? \n\nIt could be that within your trained dataset, there is low variance among the different sounds which leads to high errors. Alternatively, if a sound is trained through "Your Choice", the 5 recordings may capture vastly different sound waves for a particular sound and this can lead to inconsistencies when getting predictions.
After training 5 sounds, can I train different sounds? \n\nYes. After training 5 sounds, you can make necessary changes then tap on "TRAIN MODEL" to train the sounds again.
